title: Watch Emmanuel Jal's joyous performance at the 2019 CBC Music Festival | CBC Music
text:
"One thing I want to announce here onstage to you guys is, I just want to tell you, I am Canadian."

Emmanuel Jal started his 2019 CBC Music Festival set with this life update, having just become a Canadian citizen earlier that month. The musician, originally from South Sudan and a former child soldier, was beaming onstage as he said that he's experiencing a "different level of freedom" now, adding that, "Canadians welcomed me and gave me a lot, you know?"

Jal's set matched his mood, as he brought a joyous, summer vibe to festivalgoers who were about to weather a literal lightning storm. Watch his set below.

Emmanuel Jal performs "Forced to Sin" at CBC Music Festival 2019. 6:18

Emmanuel Jal performs "War Child Intro + Cush" at CBC Music Festival 2019. 5:17

Emmanuel Jal performs "Dusu" at CBC Music Festival 2019. 3:53

Emmanuel Jal performs "Superwoman" at CBC Music Festival 2019. 4:02

Emmanuel Jal performs "We Want Peace" at CBC Music Festival 2019. 3:51
description: Having just received his Canadian citizenship, Jal was beaming with the news.
